cyclone.name: MICHAEL
cyclone.current_location: about 180 mi SSW of Panama City, Florida
cyclone.trajectory: moving north across the northeastern Gulf, then turning northeast toward the Florida Panhandle/Big Bend and across the southeastern U.S.
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: Florida Panhandle/Big Bend near Panama City–Apalachicola

weather_observation.under_watch: Tropical Storm Watch, Storm Surge Watch
weather_observation.watch_coast: Chassahowitzka FL to Anna Maria Island FL, including Tampa Bay
weather_observation.warning_coast: N/A for Tampa Bay; hurricane and TS warnings confined to FL Panhandle–Suwannee River
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Northeastern Gulf Coast from Alabama/Florida border to Cedar Key, with surge reaching as far south as Tampa Bay
weather_observation.wind: Low chance (≤9%) of sustained tropical-storm-force winds; occasional gusts 35–45 mph possible late Wed.
weather_observation.storm_surge: 2–4 ft inundation possible in Tampa Bay and along the Manatee County coast during high tide.
weather_observation.rainfall: 1–3 inches of rain expected; localized flooding possible in poor-drainage areas.
weather_observation.other_hazards: Dangerous rip currents and rough surf; minor coastal flooding at high tide.
